Class ChatClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ChatClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class ChatClient
extends java.lang.Thread

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatClient

        public ChatClient(java.lang.String serverHostname,
                  int portNumber,
                  ChatClientGui associatedGui)
        Constructor that provides the server socket's IP address and port number. It also is used to specify the GUI used by this client.
        Parameters:
        serverHostname - Server's hostname
        portNumber - Server socket's port number
        associatedGui - The GUI used by this client.

      • ChatClient

        public ChatClient(java.lang.String serverHostname,
                  int portNumber)
        Constructor that provides the server socket's IP address and port number. This constructor is used for terminal mode.
        Parameters:
        serverHostname - Server's hostname
        portNumber - Server socket's port number

    • Method Detail

      • connectToAndGetReaderForPipedOutputStream

        private void connectToAndGetReaderForPipedOutputStream(java.io.PipedOutputStream stream)
        This function creates a PipedInputStream and connects it to the PipedOutputStream parameter. It then uses this input stream to initialize this classes' userInputReader member. This function is called during construction and is used to link messages typed by the user in the GUI (pushing data into the PipedOutputStream) to the lower level of the client (reading out of the PipedOutputStream).
        Parameters:
        stream - The GUI's side of the PipedOutputStream

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts execution of the client. Doing so will spawn two threads: 1.) A thread to monitor user input 2.) A thread to monitor data from the server and output it to the user
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • connectToSocket

        private boolean connectToSocket(java.lang.String hostname,
                                int portNumber)
        Updates this class's socket member, which includes connecting to the server.
        Parameters:
        hostname - The hostname of the server to connect to
        portNumber - The port to connect to
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • displayExceptionMessage

        void displayExceptionMessage(java.lang.String msg,
                             java.lang.Exception err)
        Displays an exception to the GUI or console depending on which the client is utilizing.
        Parameters:
        msg - Extra information to display
        err - An exception whose stack trace will be printed.

      • displayErrorMessage

        void displayErrorMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Displays an error message to the GUI or console depending on which the client is utilizing.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to display.

      • displayMessage

        private void displayMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        If the user is using the GUI, post messages to the message history window if they aren't actively typinga message. If they are typing, buffer the new message. Otherwise, write to the console's stdout
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to display

      • getSocket

        java.net.Socket getSocket()
        Returns:
        The socket that this client uses to connect to the server

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        If the user desires to run this client in command line mode, call the executable with the hostname as parameter 0 and the port as parameter 1.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments
